text: Dixons Creek is a town in Victoria, Australia, 46 km north-east of Melbourne's central business district. Its local government area is the Shire of Yarra Ranges. At the , Dixons Creek had a population of 334. The Post Office opened around 1902 and closed in 1967. Dixons Creek has a primary school, with currently 7 students. It is part of the Wollombi Cluster (11 small schools in the area). Dixons Creek was hit hard by the Black Saturday fires and many houses were unfortunately destroyed. ==References== Category:Towns in Victoria (Australia) Category:Yarra Valley
title: Dixons Creek, Victoria
